p: OM and field emission scanning electron microscopy (FESEM) were applied for investigating the hardened layer microstructure. The percentage of the ferrite phase in the average of the structure of the hardened zone was measured by Celemex software (manufacturer, city, state, country). A micro hardness V-test-analog tester was used for 30 s dwell time with 100 gr maximum load. Vickers tests were repeated three times for each treatment condition. The micro-hardness profiles through the line from the center of the hardened zone to the untreated zone in depth and width directions of the hardened area were plotted for each sample. Figure 2 shows the cross-sectional view of micro-hardness indenters in the surface and depth of the hardened cases. Furnace heat treatment according to the cycle shown in Figure 3 was performed [ 28, 29]. The AISI 4130 was preheated to 540 °C for 90 min and heated to 899 °C at a rate of 73 °C/hour and was retained for 10 min. The hardened cases were quenched in water, air, and oil.
